bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, November 2, 1895

div1.p: Reed writes to offer his house to the newlywed couple.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, November 2, 1895
div1.opener:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Nov. 2. 95.
My darling Sister;
div1.p:
I have just
this minute (4 P. M.) finished
my month's work on the Examin=
ing Board, & take the first
opportunity to reply to your
last letter- Of course, I don't
know just what plans the
Bride & groom have for their
stay in Washington, and nat=
urally I don't want to
intrude on their happiness,
If they will accept the hos=
pitality of my house, we
will be glad to have them.
If they, on the other hand, pre=
fer to be free from jokes
& c, and had rather go to a
Hotel, well & good-

I will meet them at
the Depot, Tuesday next,
& will be at their service.
The next day, they must ac=
cept the assistance of
a guide, whom I will pro=
vide, to show them the sights-
div1.closer:
Sincerely, your
brother, Walter I meant affectionately-
